p: Current pharmacotherapy includes the use of corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, 5-aminosalicylates, and biological therapies to reduce the inflammatory process through the immune system [ 15, 16]. However, the therapeutic approach to IBDs may require action on the three main pathophysiological componentsâ€”dysbiosis, intestinal permeability, and inflammation. It is believed that, in the future, therapies will be highly individualized, based on specific diagnoses, and identify which of these components is the dysfunction [ 10, 15].
